TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RequestCachePolicy extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines an application's caching requirements for resources obtained by using <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can specify a default cache policy for your application by using the <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest.DefaultCachePolicy%2A> property or the application or machine configuration files. For more information, see [\<requestCaching\> Element (Network Settings)](../Topic/%3CrequestCaching%3E%20Element%20\(Network%20Settings\).md).
You can specify the cache policy for an individual request by using the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.CachePolicy%2A> property.
Caching for Web services is not supported.
## Examples The following code example creates a policy with <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy.Level%2A> set to <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel>, and uses it to set the cache policy of a <xref:System.Net.WebRequest>.
[!code-cpp[NclSimpleCache#13](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.cache.reque_1_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclSimpleCache#13](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.cache.reque_1_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel level) cil managed

Docs.param: A that specifies the cache behavior for resources obtained using <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> objects.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. using the specified cache policy.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy.Level%2A> property to `level`.
The <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel> value controls whether caching is enabled, and when the cache can be used. For additional information, see the <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel> documentation.
## Examples The following code example creates a policy with <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy.Level%2A> set to <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel>.and uses it to set the cache policy of a <xref:System.Net.WebRequest>.
[!code-cpp[NclSimpleCache#13](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/d8f9bd1e-66aa-4280-a9c0-_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclSimpleCache#13](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/d8f9bd1e-66aa-4280-a9c0-_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets the value specified when this instance was constructed.
Docs.value: A value that specifies the cache behavior for resources obtained using <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Applications typically use <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel> as their cache policy level. Using the <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel> level, the effective cache policy is determined by the current cache policy and the age of the content in the cache. The <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.CachePolicy%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, if not `null`, determines the cache policy in effect for a request.
The default policy for the application domain can be set using the <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest.DefaultCachePolicy%2A> or the application or machine configuration file. For more information, see [\<requestCaching\> Element (Network Settings)](../Topic/%3CrequestCaching%3E%20Element%20\(Network%20Settings\).md).
## Examples The following code example creates a <xref:System.Net.Cache.RequestCacheLevel> policy and sends a request.
[!code-cpp[NclSimpleCache#13](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.net.cache.reque_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclSimpleCache#13](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.net.cache.reque_1.cs)]
